description: Time calculations, reading scales, mass, capacity, length, unit conversions, and time zones.

concepts.name: Time Calculations
concepts.description: Converting between 12-hour and 24-hour time, calculating elapsed time, time addition/subtraction
common_misconceptions: Forgetting to convert between hours and minutes
question_patterns: A watch reads {time24}. What is this in 12-hour format?
What time is {X} hours and {Y} minutes after {time}?
example_stems: Sandy's watch reads 1850. What is the time one quarter of an hour later in 12-hour format?
A train departs at 0945 and arrives at 1315. How long is the journey?

concepts.name: Time Zones
concepts.description: Calculating times across different time zones, flight arrival times
common_misconceptions: Adding instead of subtracting time difference or vice versa
question_patterns: {Person} leaves {City1} at {time}. After {X} hours flight, arrives in {City2} which is {Y} hours ahead/behind. What local time?
If it is {time} in Sydney, what time is it in London?
example_stems: Kylie leaves Las Vegas Friday at 1300 on a 6-hour flight. After 24 hours and a 20-hour flight to Sydney (17 hours ahead), what time does she arrive?
A call at 3pm Sydney time - what time in New York (16 hours behind)?

concepts.name: Reading Scales
concepts.description: Reading values from scales, dials, thermometers including between marked values
common_misconceptions: Not accounting for scale offset or error
question_patterns: The scale shows {X}. The container weighs {Y} empty. How much {substance} is there?
A faulty scale starts at {offset}. With items showing {reading}, what is actual weight?
example_stems: Rana needs 650g sauce. Scale shows 850g with jar. Empty jar is 330g. How much more needed?
A scale doesn't start at 0. Two blocks read 38kg. What is one block's weight?

concepts.name: Capacity and Volume
concepts.description: Measuring liquids, converting between mL and L, mixing liquids problems
common_misconceptions: Not tracking what was added vs removed
question_patterns: {Person} has {X}mL of {liquid}. After drinking {Y}mL and adding water to {Z}mL, how much water is left?
Mix {X} parts juice to {Y} parts water. Total {Z}mL. How much juice?
example_stems: Sooyoung has 250mL cordial and 1L water. Drinks 10mL cordial, tops up to 500mL. How much water left?
Jan puts 150mL orange juice and adds 6 times as much apple juice. Total volume?

concepts.name: Unit Conversions
concepts.description: Converting between metric units for length, mass, capacity
common_misconceptions: Multiplying when should divide or vice versa
Forgetting to convert all values to same unit
question_patterns: The graph shows rainfall in mm. How many cm is that?
example_stems: A fence is 2.5 km long. How many metres is this?
February rainfall was 450mm. How many cm is this?

concepts.name: Ratios in Measurement
concepts.description: Using ratios for mixing, scaling recipes, comparing quantities
common_misconceptions: Confusing ratio parts with actual amounts
Errors when scaling up or down
question_patterns: Mix {X} parts {A} to {Y} parts {B}. For {Z} total, how much {A}?
A recipe uses {ratio}. For {total} servings, how much of {ingredient}?
example_stems: Jan puts 150mL orange juice and 6 times as much apple juice. How much total?
A recipe needs 2 parts flour to 3 parts sugar. For 500g mixture, how much flour?
